title: Spacing
summary: Spacing is a fundamental tool for structuring layouts, guiding the user’s eye, and ensuring clarity in design. In Green, we use spacing to create hierarchy, balance, and visual rhythm, making interfaces feel intentional and easy to navigate.

columns.text: Good spacing helps distinguish elements, making interactions more intuitive. Too little space creates clutter, while too much can weaken relationships between components.
Thoughtful spacing enhances readability and usability, ensuring every element has room to breathe.
White space isn’t empty space—it’s an active part of the design. It improves focus, increases legibility, and makes interfaces feel more open and approachable.
At SEB, white space is a core principle, helping create designs that feel clear, modern, and effortless to use.
Green uses space tokens based on a 4 px grid system. This scale applies to margin, padding, gap, radius, and all spacing values, ensuring consistency across components.
When designing layouts, spacing values range from 1 px to 120 px, providing flexibility while maintaining a structured and harmonious design.
